intro: Erysimum linifolium subsp. baeticum, commonly known as the Baetican wallflower, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in open habitats such as cliffs and slopes. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, with a hairy surface, and produces bright yellow flowers in late spring.
